page.title: 13School visits and field work
page.content: Class 3 at West Haddon School have visited the Black Country Museum, Everdon Field Centre, Winwick Brook and the Cotswold Wild Life Park.The first visit of the year was to the Black Country Museum in Birmingham.In school,at the time,the class was studying the early 20th century. At the Museum the class visited old houses,pubs,shops and chapels.They saw how craftmen,such as chainmakers,used to work. The class stayed at Everdon Field Centre for a week during which time they did local studies,for example of houses and an old church. In the summer term the class spent a day on a study of Winwick Brook. They all visited Cotswold Wild Life Park for a day,when class 1 and 2 joined them.The class watched a series called "Animals in Action" in class.
